description: Drain Package - Simulates the effects of agricultural drains or other features that remove water from the aquifer at a rate proportional to the head difference

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

datasets.description: Maximum number of drain cells and output unit

variables.name: Option
variables.description: Optional keyword 'AUXILIARY' followed by auxiliary variable names, and/or 'NOPRINT'.
variables.tooltip: AUXILIARY adds extra data columns. NOPRINT suppresses drain list output to listing file.

variables.name: MXACTD
variables.description: Maximum number of drain cells active during any stress period.
variables.tooltip: Maximum number of drain entries used simultaneously across all stress periods.

variables.name: IDRNCB
variables.description: Unit number for cell-by-cell flow terms. 0=no output, >0=write to this unit.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, drain flow terms saved to binary file. If 0, no cell-by-cell output.

variables.name: ITMP
variables.description: Number of drain entries for this stress period. <0 reuses previous period data.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, ITMP drain entries follow. If 0, no drains active. If < 0, reuse previous stress period data.

variables.name: NP
variables.description: Number of parameters active in this stress period.
variables.tooltip: Number of named parameters active during this stress period. Typically 0 if not using parameters.

variables.name: Layer
variables.description: Layer number of the drain cell (1-based).

variables.name: Row
variables.description: Row number of the drain cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Row location of the drain. 1-based index.

variables.name: Column
variables.description: Column number of the drain cell (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Column location of the drain. 1-based index.

variables.name: Elevation
variables.description: Elevation of the drain (L). No flow occurs if head is below this elevation.
variables.tooltip: Drain invert elevation. When the water table is above this elevation, water flows to the drain. When below, no drain flow occurs.

variables.name: Conductance
variables.description: Hydraulic conductance of the drain-aquifer interface (L^2/T).
variables.tooltip: Controls drain flow rate. Flow = Conductance * (head - Elevation) when head > Elevation. Flow = 0 when head <= Elevation.
